intro: Vaccaria hispanica subsp. vaccaria, commonly known as Spanish catchfly, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to August. The plant has succulent, hairy leaves and produces tiny, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
